clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Outcome Following Regenerative Periodontal Treatment of Intrabony Defects
clinical_study.official_title: Long-Term Outcome Following Regenerative Periodontal Treatment of Intrabony Defects: A Retrospective Study at Mahidol University

brief_summary.textblock: Many years ago, periodontal regenerative treatment has been done in Periodontics and Oral Medicine Clinic, Faculty of Dentistry, Mahidol University, Bangkok, Thailand. However, there is still lacking of study about long-term result of periodontal regenerative treatment of intrabony defects.

detailed_description.textblock: Beside, in the present, some materials for periodontal regenerative treatment are still expensive. Periodontists and patients have to plan together based on not only rationale of treatment but also cost and effectiveness. Thus the long-term result of treatment could be useful for the decision making.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of regenerative-treated tooth loss after periodontal regeneration
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of regenerative-treated tooth loss since 1 year after periodontal regeneration until last visit of supportive periodontal treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of regenerative-treated sites with clinical attachment loss ≥ 2 mm
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of regenerative-treated sites with clinical attachment loss ≥ 2 mm since 1 year after periodontal regeneration until last visit of supportive periodontal treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Variables (patient and tooth characteristics) that associated with tooth loss or clinical attachment loss
secondary_outcome.description: Patient variables and tooth characteristics associated with regenerative-treated tooth loss or sites with clinical attachment loss ≥ 2 mm from any supportive periodontal treatment visits (the last supportive periodontal treatment visit) compared to baseline or 1-year after surgery.

arm_group.description: regenerated treated teeth with clinical attachment loss ≥ 2 mm
regenerated treated teeth with clinical attachment loss < 2 mm

intervention.description: number of regeneration treated teeth loss

intervention.intervention_name: regenerated treated teeth with clinical attachment loss
intervention.description: regenerated treated teeth with clinical attachment loss ≥ 2 mm

study_pop.textblock: The patients who received regenerative periodontal therapy of the intrabony defects by post-graduate students at the Periodontics and Oral Medicine Clinic, Faculty of Dentistry, Mahidol University, Thailand and were placed in the Recall Patient Bank from 2000 to 2014.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received regenerative therapy of the intrabony defects
- Patients who had the record of re-evaluation at 1 year post-surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received regenerative therapy involving the furcation area
- Patients who received non-periodontal regenerative therapy
- Patients who received endodontic regeneration
- Patients who had an incomplete periodontal data recording
